There is a collection of functions which are particularly nice to work with. These are the
linear functions

, also called linear maps, linear homomorphisms, or linear transformations.

We find that every linear function can be
described by a matrix
A preview of the relationship between linear maps and matrices
and, conversely, every matrix describes a linear function. Thus we can leverage our knowledge of matrix algebra in the study of linear transformations.

intro.para: These three examples of linear transformations are ‘atomic’ in the sense that every linear transformation can be built from them, as we will learn later on.

properties

Of particular interest are those linear transformations whose transformation effect can be reversed: These are the
invertible linear transformations
A preview of invertible linear transformations
